result.execSummary:
The defendant Connelius Gladney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Connelius Gladney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Connelius Gladney was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Connelius Gladney was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Connelius Gladney in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Connelius Gladney in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections straight time CONCURRENT with Count 5
As to Count 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections straight time CONCURRENT with Count 4
The sentences are CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court grants 97 days credit.
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on  1 YEAR probation.
  Conditions of Probation:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 50 hours of community service
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Provide a DNA sample
- no possession of firearms

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1725.00 to Mark G joint and several with 15CF2432
Pay DNA surcharges
Pay court costs;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Connelius Gladney in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court addressed 10/28/2015 violation report.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation report of missed office contact, received and filed

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Enhanced Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.     Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defense motion to amend the bail heard.

As to Counts 4 & 5:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Amended Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  As to Count 1:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed the count.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 19.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge the addition of two charges.  Count 4:  Misdemeanor Battery , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 , a Class A misdemeanor and Count 5 Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a).
From Attorney Patrick Flanagen informing the court that his trial in Br. 40 was declared a mistrial.  Attorney Flanagen to appear in Br. 19

Defendant Connelius Gladney in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel Flanagen is in trial in Br. 40.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19 on 11/10/15 at 8:30 am

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Connelius Gladney not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Connelius Gladney in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Connelius Gladney in custody.  Michael Lonski for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  (Defense Counsel is not able to appear for previously scheduled co-defendant's scheduling date of July 27, 2015 due to previously scheduled court appearance date.)

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MARK G. OR HIS RESIDENCE AND CO-DEF: DAWAN HOLMAN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Connelius Gladney in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Connelius Gladney in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
